These benefits range from enhanced damage control to the ability to make hyperspace jump calculations. When installed on larger starships, this attachment represents can represent more than a single socket. name: Luxury Passenger Compartments
reference: Please see page 65 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO] to all Charm, Deception, and Negotiation checks made against passengers within the vehicle.  Checks made against passengers who are accustomed to opulence and luxury have up to [SE][SE] removed instead.

details: Base Modifiers: Add a boost die to all Charm, Deception, and Negotiation checks made against passengers within the vehicle. Checks made against passengers who are accustomed to opulence and luxury have up to two setback dice removed instead.
description: The rich and the powerful are used to luxury, and may not be receptive to negotiating unless they feel treated with upmost respect and granted all the luxuries they 'deserve'.

name: Holonet Pirate Array
reference: Please see page 65 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Transmissions sent with this attachment can reach any facility that has access to interstellar communications.  Transmissions can be intercepted with a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b], provided someone is aware of the transmission.

added_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE] to enemy checks to intercept outgoing transmissions.
Add [BO] to intercept HoloNet traffic

details: Base Modifiers: A ship equipped with a HoloNet pirate array gains unique communications and monitoring capabilities. Transmissions sent by a ship so equipped can reach any facility that has access to interstellar communications. Such transmissions arrive without delay, and cannot be intercepted unless the pirate array is being tracked by another HoloNet user, who must already be aware of the pirate array. A HoloNet user, whether equipped with a pirate array or a legitimate transceiver, can intercept transmissions with a Hard difficulty Computers check, provided [they] are aware of the sender or recipient. At the GM's discretion, [they] may upgrade the difficulty of the check to reflect particularly impressive security protocols. A despair result on a check to intercept a transmission can be spent by the GM to reveal the attempted interception and its source. Modification Options: 2 add a setback die to enemy checks to intercept outgoing transmission Mods, 2 add a boost die to intercept HoloNet traffic Mods.
description: The HoloNet was built back in the days of the Old Republic, and though today the Empire has a tight grip on it, schematics of transceivers can still be found on old databanks. By making some modifications, one can set up an extra transceiver which can siphon out transmissions.

name: Environmental Simulators
reference: Please see page 64 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can replicate up to three different planetary environments, one at a time.  When making Charm or Negotiation checks against members of species native to replicated environment, add an automatic [AD][AD] to pool.

added_mods.misc_desc: Additional planetary environment

details: Base Modifiers: A ship with this attachment installed can replicate up to three different planetary environments, chosen at the time of installation. Replicating a planetary environment takes at least one hour or up to a day for extreme changes. A character making Charm or Negotiation checks against members of species native to replicated environment adds two automatic advantage results to the pool. This system can only reproduce one environment at any given time. Modification Options: 2 additional planetary environment Mods.
description: Species of the galaxy live in vastly different environments, but most vessels are fitted with a standard environment. Adapting one's diplomatic vessel to the desires of their guests can really lighten the mood.

name: Briefing Auditorium
reference: Please see page 58 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Characters briefed in this auditorium prior to a mission remove [SE] due to known mission conditions from skill checks for the duration of the mission.

added_mods.misc_desc: Add [AD] to Leadership checks made by characters within the briefing auditorium

description: Most dedicated warships, especially those in service with the Imperial Navy, have special compartments set aside for the briefing and debriefing of fighter, gunboat, and shuttle pilots, ground vehicle drivers, and ground combat forces.
details: Ships of silhouette 5 or larger can be fitted with a briefing auditorium. Base Modifiers: Characters briefed in this auditorium prior to a mission remove a Black Setback die due to known mission conditions from skill checks for the duration of the mission. Modification Options: 2 Add an Advantage result to Leadership checks made by characters within the briefing auditorium Mods.

name: Electronic Counter-Countermeasures Suite
reference: Please see page 59 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] to cancel all effects of an electronic countermeasures suite.

added_mods.misc_desc: Decrease difficulty of the Computers check by 1

description: "Electronic counter-countermeasures" (ECCM) is a catchall term for a number of techniques, such as FAST ECM detection, frequency hopping, pulse compression, and polarization filtering, used to prevent or break comms and sensor jamming caused by enemy electronic countermeasures.
details: Models Include: Fabritech 830 "Stutterer" ECCM system, Miradyne A5x.4 "Oracle" ECCM suite (starfighters and shuttles only), KDY Advanced Capital ECCM suite (gunships, cruisers, and battleships only). Base Modifiers: May make a Hard (3 Difficulty) Computers check to cancel all effects of an Electronic Countermeasures Suite. Modification Options: 1 Decrease the difficulty of the Computers check by 1 Mod.

name: Holo-Tank
reference: Please see page 59 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Characters utilizing a holo-tank may always use Cool or Knowledge (Warfare)  when making Initiative checks.

added_mods.misc_desc: Add [AD] to Mass Combat checks when acting force commander is on board this ship
Upgrade the ability of checks when determining Initiative once

details: Models Include: Imlok Technologies ARENA-2500, Bross Mk. IX Tactical holoprojector, Chedak Communications "Omni-View" LS-220 holo-tank. Base Modifiers: Characters utilizing a holo-tank may always use Cool or Knowledge (Warfare) when making Initiative checks. Modification Options: 2 Add an advantage result to Mass Combat checks when the acting force commander is on board this ship Mods, 1 Upgrade the ability of checks when determining Initiative once Mod.
description: "Holo-tank" is a catchall term for a type of holoprojection system used aboard starships and in military facilities.

name: Tactical Command, Control, and Communications Suite
reference: Please see page 59 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: While active, a force commander in the vehicle upgrades the ability of all Mass Combat checks once

added_mods.misc_desc: Allies benefiting from Situational Awareness remove [SE] on Perception and Vigilance checks

description: Mounted to ships and vehicles piloted by designated squadron leaders, the TC3 suite allows the sharing of data and sensor telemetry between networked ships or vehicles.
details: Base Modifiers: While active, an active force commander in the vehicle upgrades the ability of all Mass Combat checks they make once. Modification Options: 1 innate talent (Situational Awareness talent) Mod, 1 Allies benefiting from Situational Awareness talent remove a Black Setback die on Perception and Vigilance checks Mod.

name: Theater Command and Control System
reference: Please see page 59 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: While active, force commander on the bridge upgrades the ability of all Mass Combat checks twice

added_mods.misc_desc: Gain an additional [AD] on Mass Combat checks
Remove [SE] from Mass Combat checks

description: A theater command and control system (TCCS) grants a commanding officer and staff incredible control over large-scale conflicts.
details: Fitted to ships or vehicles of silhouette 4 or larger. Models Include: Various models. Base Modifiers: While active, an active force commander on the bridge of the starship upgrades the ability of all Mass Combat checks they make twice. Modification Options: 2 Gain an additional Advantage result on Mass Combat checks Mods, 1 Remove a Black Setback die from Mass Combat checks Mod.

name: Custom Grip
reference: Please see page 54 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Anyone other than owner adds [SE][SE] to combat checks using this weapon.

description: A skilled tinkerer can tailor a weapon to perfectly fits its wielder's hand.
details: This attachment can be applied to any weapon with a handle. Models Include: None. Base Modifiers: Remove a Black Setback die from all combat checks the weapon's owner makes using this weapon. Anyone other than the owner instead adds two Black Setback dice to all combat checks made using it. Modification Options: 1 Item Quality (Accurate +1) Mod.

name: Enhanced XCiter
reference: Please see page 54 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: GM may spend [DE][DE] to cause blaster to explode, destroying blaster and inflicting automatic Critical Injury on wielder.

description: Technicians, Engineers, and Tinkerers have long known how to modify the gas conversion XCiter in a blaster to yield a more highly energetic—and correspondingly more destructive—payload.
details: This attachment can be applied to any blaster. Models Include: Outlaw Tech Custom XCiter. Base Modifiers: Decrease critical rating by 1 (to a minimum of 1). The GM may spend two Despair results from any combat check using the weapon to cause the blaster to explode, destroying it and inflicting an automatic Critical Injury on the wielder. Modification Options: 3 Item Quality (Pierce +1) Mod.

name: Gyrostabilizer
reference: Please see page 54 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.
description: A gyrostabilizer, or repulsorlift harness, artificially reduces the weight of a weapon, allowing a user to heft and aim a heavy weapon with greatly decreased difficulty.
details: This attachment can be applied to any Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery Weapon. Models Include: TaggeCo. Type 2 Repulsorlift Harness, BlasTech Mk. IV Gyrostabilization Unit. Base Modifiers: Decreases Cumbersome quality by 1. Modification Options: 3 Decrease Cumbersome quality by 1 Mods, 1 Innate Talent (Barrage talent) Mod.

name: Integrated Scanner
reference: Please see page 54 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Weapon incorporates a general-purpose scanner.
Wielder adds automatic [AD][AD] to Initiative checks while weapon is drawn.

added_mods.misc_desc: Remove [SE] from Initiative checks

description: There are times when a trooper needs to scan an area for danger as well as keep their weapon at the ready.
details: This attachment can be applied to any Ranged (Heavy) weapon. Models Include: Carbanti United Electronics Mk. II Omni-Scope, CryonCorp "Heads-Up" Scanner Suite. Base Modifiers: The weapon incorporates a General Purpose Scanner that the wielder can use while the weapon is drawn. The wielder adds two automatic Advantage results to Initiative checks while the weapon is drawn. Modification Options: 2 Remove a Black Setback die from Initiative checks Mods.

name: Optimized Energy Cell
reference: Please see page 54 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When GM spends [DE] or [TH] to cause the weapon to run out of ammo, it requires an additional [TH].

description: In a fire fight, there is no such thing as having too many shots left in your blaster.
details: This attachment can applied to any energy weapon. Models Include: Czerka Arms Model 4 Expanded Gas Reservoir, BlasTech X-3 Extended Energy Cell. Base Modifiers: When the GM would spend a Despair result or a number of Threat results to cause the weapon to run out of ammunition, it requires an additional Threat to have that effect apply to this weapon. Modification Options: None.

name: Overcharged Actuating Module
reference: Please see page 55 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: GM may spend [TH][TH] to damage weapon by one step.

description: While some weaponsmiths try to squeeze every last bit of energy form a power cell, others try to cram as much energy as they can into every shot.
details: This attachment can be applied to any blaster pistol or carbine. Models Include: BlasTech Mk. II Actuating Module, SoroSuub BlastPro. Base Modifiers: Increases weapon damage by +1. The Game Master may spend two Threat results from any combat check made with this weapon to have it become damaged one step. Modification Options: 1 Damage +1 Mod.

name: Rapid-Recharge XCiter
reference: Please see page 55 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.
description: Specially modified gas conversion enablers (XCiters) can allow a blaster pistol or rifle to achieve much higher rates of fire than factory standard, even rivaling those of a true repeating blaster.
details: This attachment can be applied to any blaster. Models Include: BlasTech XCelerator, SoroSuub M-3 Cycling Module, various custom models. Base Modifiers: The weapon gains the Auto-Fire quality and the Inaccurate 3 quality. Modification Options: 2 Decrease Inaccurate quality by 1 Mods.

name: Removed Safety Features
reference: Please see page 55 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds [BO] to first combat check during an encounter.
GM may spend [TH][TH] to cause misfire.  Weapon runs out of ammo and inflicts 4 strain on wielder.

description: By removing or deactivating weapon safeties and other features, a gun can more easily be drawn and readied for combat.
details: This attachment can be applied to any Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) weapon that could logically have such elements to remove. Models Include: None. Base Modifiers: Adds a Blue Boost die to the first combat check made with the weapon during an encounter. The Game Master may spend two Threat results or a Despair result from any combat check to have the weapon misfire, running out of ammunition and inflicting 4 strain on the wielder. Modification Options: None.

name: Secondary Ion Blaster
reference: Please see page 56 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds an ion blaster to the weapon.

description: Among the many weapons mounted on the underside of rifles is one that saw a lot of use during the Clone Wars.
details: This attachment can be used with any Ranged (Heavy) weapon. Models Include: SoroSuub Droid Defender, BlasTech Model 9 Under-Barrel Ion Blaster. Base Modifiers: Enables the weapon to fire using the following profile at the user's choice: (Ranged - Heavy; Damage 10; Critical 5; Range [Short]; Disorient 5, Ion). Adds Cumbersome (+1) to weapon and increases encumbrance by 1. Modification Options: 2 Increase ion blaster's damage by +1 Mods.

name: Sonic Scope
reference: Please see page 56 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May observe and target enemies who are completely hidden by solid objects.

description: Developed to overcome personal cloaking devices and other sensor-baffling defenses, a sonic scope uses ultrasonic sound waves to detect a target and generate a visual representation.
details: This attachment can be used with any Ranged (Heavy) weapon. Models Include: CryonCorp PL-1 "Second Sight" Scope, SoroSuub Model Z Integrated Sonar System. Base Modifiers: The character may observe and target enemies who are completely hidden by solid objects that the weapon can penetrate. At the Game Master's discretion, the target might receive additional defense or even soak to reflect shooting through a solid object. Modification Options: 1 Skill (Cool) Mod, 1 Skill (Vigilance) Mod, 2 Innate Talent (Precise Aim talent) Mods.

name: Stripped Down
reference: Please see page 56 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE] to Perception checks to find the weapon when hidden.

description: By removing redundant components and stripping down the body, it is possible to significantly reduce the weight and profile of a blaster or other weapon.
details: This attachment can be used with any Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) weapon. Models Include: None. Base Modifiers: Decrease the weapon's encumbrance by 1 (to a minimum of 1). Add a Black Setback die to a character's Perception checks to find the weapon when it is hidden. Modification Options: 2 Decrease encumbrance by 1 (to a minimum of 1) Mods.

name: Under-Barrel Grapnel Launcher
reference: Please see page 56 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As an action, may make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged (Light) check[b] to secure grappling hook to an object within medium range and reel in cord.
May pull another character aloft by making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Athletics check[b].

description: Often seen among mercenary and special operations forces, under-barrel grapnel launchers provide a quick way to scale sheer surfaces in the midst of a combat situation or during a covert infiltration.
details: This attachment can be used with any Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) weapon that could logically have a grapnel launcher mounted on it. Models Include: Merr-Sonn KR-2 Auxiliary Grapnel, TaggeCo "Skysailer" Grapnel Launcher. Base Modifiers: As an action, a character may make an Average (2 Difficulty) Ranged - Light to secure the grappling hook to an object within medium range. On success, as an action, they may reel in the cord, pulling themselves to the object (or, if the object is unsecured and lighter than they are, pulling it to them). A character may use the grappling hook to pull another character aloft with them; if they do, they must make an Average (2 Difficulty) Athletics check to avoid losing their grip on their partner or the gun. Increases weapon's encumbrance by 2. Modification Options: None.

name: Vibro-Bayonet
reference: Please see page 56 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds a vibro-bayonet to the weapon

description: Although most fights are resolved with exchanges of blaster fire, a close-range fire fight can quickly turn into a melee.
details: This attachment can only be applied to any Ranged (Heavy) weapon that could logically mount a bayonet. Models Include: Czerka Arms "Last Resort" Vibro-Bayonet, Merr-Sonn Model 3 Combat Attachment. Base Modifiers: Enables the weapon to be used in melee combat with the following profile at the user's choice: (Melee; Damage +1; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Inaccurate 1, Pierce 2, Vicious 1). Modification Options: 2 Increase the Melee weapon's damage by 1 Mods.

name: Amphibious Modification
reference: Please see page 57 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Provides up to five hours of oxygen in submersive or airless environments.  Does not protect against vacuum.
Removes [SE] from physical checks due to underwater conditions.

added_mods.misc_desc: Increase oxygen supply by two hours

details: This attachment can be applied to any armor that could logically have an air tank attached. Models Include: Gandorthral Atmospherics Submersible 9, BioTech Mk. II Air Supply. Base Modifiers: The armor provides enough oxygen (or applicable gas) for up to five hours of submersion or in any airless environment (although it does not protect against vacuum). In addition, the user removes a setback die from physical checks due to underwater conditions. Modification Options: 2 Increase oxygen supply by two hours Mods.
description: For those sentients without the evolutionary adaptation of gills, specialized equipment is necessary for surviving in a liquid environment.

name: Custom Fit
reference: Please see page 57 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Removes [SE] from Athletics and Stealth checks.

added_mods.misc_desc: Remove an additional [SE] from Athletics and Stealth checks

description: Although standard "off-the-shelf" armor can provide invaluable protection, it can also prove bulky or awkward, even after adjustments.
details: This attachment can be applied to any armor. Models Include: Numerous variants. Base Modifiers: Character removes a Black Setback die from Athletics and Stealth checks while wearing the armor. Modification Options: 1 Remove an additional Black Setback die from Athletics and Stealth checks while wearing the armor Mod.

name: Integrated Ascension Gear
reference: Please see page 57 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As an action, may make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged (Light) check[b] to secure grappling hook to an object within medium range and reel in cord.
May pull another character aloft by making an [B]Easy ([DI]) Athletics check[b].

description: Incorporating a grapnel launcher, line, clips, and other climbing and rappelling equipment directly into a set of armor ensures that the user is always prepared to ascend or descend sheet surfaces in a hurry.
details: This attachment can be applied to any armor. Models Include: TaggeCo. Integrated Ascension Unit, VargeCorp ClimbAll Armor. Base Modifiers: As an action, the character may make an Average (2 Difficulty) Ranged - Light to secure the grappling hook to an object within medium range. Upon success, as an action, they may reel in the cord, pulling themselves to the object (or, if the object is unsecured and lighter than they are, pulling it to them). The character may use the grappling hook to pull another character aloft with them; if they do, they must make an Easy (1 Difficulty) Athletics check to avoid losing their grip on their partner. Modification Options: None.

name: Integrated Slicer Gear
reference: Please see page 58 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Counts as having Slicer Gear.  Can be controlled by gesture or voice.

description: Slicers often conduct their work under strict time constrains and less-than-ideal conditions.
details: This attachment can be applied to any armor. Models Include: MerenData Mobile XR-1, numerous custom variants. Base Modifiers: The wearer counts as having Slicer Gear, which can be controlled simply by gesturing or vocalizing. Adds a Black Setback die to all checks made by others to correctly identify that the character is slicing. Modification Options: 1 Innate Talent (Technical Aptitude talent) Mod.

name: Ion Shielding
reference: Please see page 58 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Increase soak by 3 against weapons with Ion quality.

added_mods.misc_desc: Increase ranged and melee defense by 1 against weapons with Ion quality

description: Rarely encounted in body armor and more commonly (and usually illegally) applied directly to a droid chassis, ion shielding provides protection against ionization blasters.
details: This attachment can be applied to any armor with soak 2 or higher. Models Include: Outlaw Tech Ion Shielding, Industrial Automaton Mk. III Ion Guard. Base Modifiers: Increases armor's soak by +3 against weapons with the Ioncrease ranged and melee defense by +1 against weapons with the Ion quality Mod.

name: Radiation Shielding
reference: Please see page 58 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO][BO] to Resilience checks to resist radiation.

added_mods.misc_desc: Increase armor's soak by 1 against damage caused by radiation

description: The galaxy contains many perils, and one of the most common is radiation.
details: This attachment can only be applied to armor with hard plates that can be fully sealed, at the GM's discretion. This attachment can only be applied to laminate armor, heavy battle armor, and any other armor that can be fully sealed. Models Include: Loronar Model 4 Hostile Environment Treatment, Neuro-Saav Radiological Hazard Shielding. Base Modifiers: Adds two Blue Boost dice to Resilience checks to resist radiation. Modification Options: 2 Increase armor's soak by +1 against damage caused by radiation Mods.

name: Reinforced Gauntlets
reference: Please see page 58 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May use gauntlets as a melee weapon.

description: Additional armor plating on the hands is a valuable upgrade for those who favor heavier armor, as well as for those who do welding jobs on starships and desire to keep all of their fingers.
details: This attachment can be applied to any armor with soak 2 or higher. Models Include: Various models. Base Modifiers: The character can use the gauntlets as a weapon with the following profile: (Brawl ; Damage +1; Critical 4; Range [Engaged]; Disorient 3). Modification Options: 1 Innate Talent (Durable talent) Mod.

name: Self-Repair Systems
reference: Please see page 58 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Once per encounter as a maneuver, can have armor attempt to repair itself or assist in a repair.  Counts as Intellect 2 and Mechanics 2 ([PR][PR]).
There is no cost to repair armor, whether using the automatic feature, or personally repairing.

description: Some suits of armor include sophisticated self-repair suites not dissimilar to the systems found in some droids.
details: This attachment can be applied to any armor with melee or ranged defense of 1 or higher. Models Include: Industrial Automaton Model 3 Autorepair Suite, AccuTronics Advanced Repair Unit. Base Modifiers: Once per encounter, as a maneuver, the wearer can have the armor attempt to repair itself or provide assistance to a character on a check to repair it; it counts as having an Intellect of 2 and 2 ranks in the Mechanics skill for the check. In addition, there is no cost to repair the armor, whether utilizing only the automatic repair functionality or performing the repair personally. Modification Options: None.

name: All-Terrain Legs
reference: Please see page 65 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As a maneuver, pilot may shift in or out of walker mode.  In walker mode, pilot uses Piloting (Planetary) and speed is reduced to 2.

added_mods.misc_desc: Remove [SE] from Piloting (Planetary) checks due to difficult terrain
Remove [SE] from Gunnery checks due to cover or terrain

description: Although ion drives and repulsorlifts dominate the galaxy, the continued use of walkers by the Empire and certain planetary militias is a testament to the advantages of such craft.
details: This attachment can be applied to any airspeeder or starship that can land on a planet. Models Include: Kuat Drive Yards KR-2 "Crab" Auxiliary Locomotion Unit, Alto Industries Variable Combat Kit. Base Modifiers: As a maneuver, the pilot may shift the vehicle into or out of walker mode. While in walker mode, the vehicle operates as a walker (and thus uses the Piloting - Planetary skill if it did not already), and the vehicle's maximum speed is reduced to 2 if it was higher. Walker mode can only be employed in appropriate terrain, as determined by the GM. Modification Options: 2 Remove a Black Setback die from Piloting - Planetary checks due to difficult terrain Mods, 2 Remove a Black Setback die from Gunnery checks due to cover or terrain Mods.

name: Amphibious Modification
reference: Please see page 65 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Vehicle can operate underwater without penalty.

details: This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship that can enter atmosphere. Base Modifiers: Vehicle can operate underwater without penalty.
description: For those sentients without the evolutionary adaptation of gills, specialized equipment is necessary for surviving in a liquid environment.

name: Decoy Buoy
reference: Please see page 65 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Buoy may be jettisoned as an action.
Buoy can be programmed with a specific transponder code with a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b].
Buoy can be set to transmit a distress signal or other data.
A character operating ship sensors must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] to identify that the buoy is not an actual ship.
After being jettisoned, buoy no longer counts as being attached to the ship until it is reattached.

added_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE] to Computers checks to identify the buoy

description: Although ion drives and repulsorlifts dominate the galaxy, the continued use of walkers by the Empire and certain planetary militias is a testament to the advantages of such craft.
details: This attachment can be applied to any starship. Models Include: Numerous custom variants. Base Modifiers: A decoy buoy can be jettisoned as an action. The buoy appears to sensors to be a ship, and it can be programmed with a specific transponder signal with a Hard (3 Difficulty) Computers check. In addition, the buoy can be set to transmit a distress signal or other data. A character operating a ship's sensors can make a Hard (3 Difficulty) Computers check to identify that the buoy is not an actual ship. After the buoy is jettisoned, it no longer counts as being attached to the ship until reattached. Modification Options: 2 Add Black Setback die to Computers checks to identify the buoy Mods.

name: Encrypted Computer
reference: Please see page 65 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Upgrade difficulty of all Computers checks made to slice the ship's computer system once.

added_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE] to Computers checks made to slice the ship's computer systems

description: A skilled Slicer knows how to protect a computer system from others skilled in electronic skulduggery, and is likely to take steps to do just that.
details: This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship. Models Include: Numerous custom variants. Base Modifiers: Upgrade the difficulty of all Computers checks made to slice into the ship's computer systems once. Modification Options: 2 Add a Black Setback die to Computers checks made to slice the ship's computer systems Mods.

name: Enhanced Hyperspace Shields
reference: Please see page 66 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Downgrade difficulty of Astrogation checks made to navigate the ship through hyperspace once.

added_mods.misc_desc: Remove [SE] from Astrogation checks made to navigate the ship through hyperspace

description: Few things are more dangerous to a ship than colliding with a mass shadow in hyperspace.
details: This attachment can be applied to any starship with a hyperdrive. Models Include: Kuat Drive Yards PR-2 Enhanced Particle Shielding, numerous custom variants. Base Modifiers: Downgrade the difficulty of Astrogation checks to navigate this ship through hyperspace once. Modification Options: 2 Remove a Black Setback die from Astrogation checks to navigate this ship through hyperspace Mods.

name: Enhanced Repulsorlift
reference: Please see page 65 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.
description: As one might well guess from their name, speeders are swift craft by nature.
details: This attachment can be applied to any airspeeder or landspeeder. Models Include: Ubrikkian Transports Ultralift 2000. Base Modifiers: Increase vehicle's speed by 1. Decrease vehicle's handling by 1. Modification Options: 1 Innate Talent (Defensive Driving talent) Mod.

name: Gunner Droid Brain
reference: Please see page 66 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.
description: Much more than a simple targeting computer, a specialized droid brain can be installed on a ship to operate its weapons independently or assist a sentient gunner.
details: This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship. Models Include: GoCorp CD-14c. Base Modifiers: Droid brain can perform Gunnery checks for vehicle with a Gunnery skill of 2 and an Agility of 0 (if unassisted, it rolls two ability dice for Gunnery checks). Although a droid brain can be connected to more than one weapon system, it is still limited to one action per turn. Modification Options: 2 Increase the droid brain's Gunnery skill by 1 Mods.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add a droid brain with Gunnery 2 and Agility 0.

added_mods.misc_desc: Increase the droid brain's Gunnery skill by 1

name: Laser Focusing Array
reference: Please see page 66 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add automatic [AD] to combat checks made with the ship's laser cannons and turbolasers.

description: Laser cannons are the mainstay weapons of many ships, and manufacturers constantly compete to outdo each other in their products' power, accuracy, and rate of fire.
details: This attachment can be applied to any starship. Models Include: Taim & Bak G-1 Enhanced Laser Focusing Array, Loronar Corporation Mk. III Optimized Galven Coils. Base Modifiers: Add an automatic Advantage result to combat checks made with the ship's laser cannons and turbolasers. Modification Options: None.

name: Overcharged Ion Engines
reference: Please see page 66 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.
description: People living on the fringes of galactic society—and those involved in criminal pursuits, in particular—often need to move quickly when things turn bad.
details: This attachment can be applied to any starship of silhouette 3 or smaller. Models Include: Gallofree Yards Option-3 Acceleration Optimizer, Various Custom Models. Base Modifiers: Increase vehicle's speed by 1. Decrease vehicle's handling by 1. Modification Options: 1 Innate Talent (Short Cut) Mod, 1 Innate Talent (Tricky Target) Mod.

name: Pseudo-Cloaking Device
reference: Please see page 66 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Increase the difficulty of checks to detect the ship with sensors by two.
Upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks once against the ship at Short range or further.

added_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE] to combat checks targetting ship at Short range or further

details: This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship. Models Include: Fabritech Gx-3 Sensor Screen, Sienar Intelligence Systems Electronic Masking System. Modification Options: 2 Add a setback die to combat checks targeting ship at Short range or further away Mods.
description: While true cloaking devices are all but unheard of and limited to capital ships, so-called "pseudo-cloaks" incorporate an array of electronic masking devices and countermeasures to render a ship almost invisible to sensors.

name: Secondary Transponder
reference: Please see page 67 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Crew can switch to the secondary transponder as an action, making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check[b].
An observer who scans the ship can detect discrepancies indicating the presence of a secondary transponder with a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b].

added_mods.misc_desc: Activate secondary transponder as a maneuver
Add one additional ship identity

At the time of installation, the players and GM should determine the name and other details of the false identity. Because the ship's engine signature is part of the identifying information, the false identity must be of the same class of ship and preferably of a similar model. An observer who scans the ship can detect discrepancies indicating the presence of a secondary transponder with a Daunting (4 Difficulty) Computers check. Modification Options: 1 Activate secondary transponder as a maneuver Mod, 3 Add one additional ship identity Mods.

name: Security Measures
reference: Please see page 67 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

details: This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship. Models Include: Corellian Engineering Corporation SecurePro, Kuat Drive Yards LockDown Plus. Base Modifiers: Upgrade the difficulty of Computers and Skulduggery checks made to gain unauthorized access to the ship twice. Modification Options: 2 Add a Black Setback die to Computers and Skulduggery checks made to gain unauthorized access to the ship Mods.

name: Slicing Computer
reference: Please see page 67 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Counts as slicer gear that can be used by one passenger.
Add automatic [AD] to Computers checks made to slice enemy ships' systems.

description: Although most starships include sophisticated computers and comm equipment capable of slicing into the systems of enemy vessels, such as electronic warfare tactics are usually overlooked in favor of more conventional attacks.
details: This attachment can be applied to any starship. Models Include: Various custom models. Base Modifiers: Counts as Slicer Gear that be used by one passenger. Add an automatic Advantage result to Computers checks made to slice enemy ships' systems. Modification Options: 2 Innate Talent (Codebreaker talent) Mods, 1 Innate Talent (Defensive Slicing talent) Mod.

name: XV-09 Chemical Restraint Harness
reference: Please see page 44 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.
description: The XV-09 Pacifier is one of the more uncommon products sold by Xenovet.
details: Using a Pacifier on a wild animal is a temporary fix at best, and should only be done in emergencies. Mounting the harness on a creature requires a Hard difficulty Survival check to ensure the harness is fitted properly and the auto-hypo is situated correctly. The difficulty of this check can be reduced by 1 with a successful Knowledge (Xenology) check. If successful, the XV-09 grants two boost dice to any Survival checks made to control the beast wearing the harness. In addition, creatures that are successfully pacified gain a boost die to any Discipline checks. Game Masters can spend any threat result generated by the initial Survival check to reflect one or more negative side effects caused by the drugs. In addition, the Game Master can spend three threat results or a despair result to reflect a catastrophic reaction to the drugs, such as a heart attack or brain aneurysm, which results in the animal's death. While safe for use on animals, the powerful mixture of chemicals in the harness can be dangerous to the minds of sentient beings. Attaching the harness to a sentient being can result in permanent brain damage and even death.

base_mods.misc_desc: Pacified beasts gain [BOOST] to any [B]Displine Checks[b].

name: Riding Tack
reference: Please see page 47 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.
description: Riding tack is a catchall term for the assorted bits of equipment needed to ride or control a beast.
details: Tack can only be worn by riding or working animals. Using tack allows a character to ride the beast without suffering the bareback riding penalties.

base_mods.misc_desc: Characters may ride beast without suffering bareback riding penalties.

name: Saddlebags
reference: Please see page 47 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.
description: Made by purveyors of animal-handling gear such as VeTech and Piccatech, saddlebags are indispensable pieces of equipment for those who make their livings riding or working with beasts.
details: Saddlebags can only be worn by riding animals, They increase an animal's encumbrance threshold by 4.

name: Beam Splitter
reference: Please see page 51 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.
description: Similar to the spread barrel modification for blaster rifles, beam splitters function by modifying the Galven pattern and carefully mounting three or more emitters into a honeycomb configuration inside a stock blaster barrel.
details: This attachment can be applied to any blaster or suitable energy weapon that does not have the Blast quality. Models Include:ArMek RE-312 Beam Splitter, Safidine "Sweeper" Emitter Modification Kit, Concordian Crescent Technologies ZE-1111 Spread Barrel. Base Modifiers: Grants the Blast item quality with a value equal to half the weapon's damage (rounded up). Reduces the weapon's range by 1 to a minimum of engaged. Modification Options: 2 Item Quality (Disorient +1) Mods.

name: Built-In Blaster Sight
reference: Please see page 51 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Remove [SE] added by the Called Shot use of the Aim maneuver from Ranged Light and Ranged Heavy checks.

description: A typical modification used by the Rebellion's Spec-Force troops, this attachment allows a harmless beam of energy to trickle out of the barrel on a half-trigger pull to "paint" the target, letting the wielder see exactly where [they are] aiming.
details: This attachment can be applied to energy ranged weapons. Models Include: Neuro-Savv "Deadeye" Sight, Tana Ire y-30Z Targeting Beam. Base Modifiers: Remove a Black Setback die added by the Called Shot use of the Aim maneuver from Ranged - Light and Ranged - Heavy checks. Modification Options: None.

name: Galven Pattern Resequencing
reference: Please see page 51 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Adds automatic [TH][TH] to all combat checks made using this weapon.

description: Some operatives would gladly trade a little reliability in exchange for the stopping power necessary to penetrate an opponent's armor.
details: This attachment can only be used with blaster pistols and heavy blaster pistols. Models Include: None. Base Modifiers: Increases weapon damage by 1. Adds two automatic Threat results to all combat checks made using this weapon. Modification Options: 2 Damage +1 Mods, 2 Item Quality (Pierce +1) Mods.

name: Damping Emitter
reference: Please see page 51 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As a maneuver, my adjust lightsaber to deal Stun damage.  Decrease damage by 2, increase critical rating by 1, lose Breach quality.

added_mods.misc_desc: Stun Damage +1

Base Modifiers: As a maneuver, the wielder of the lightsaber may adjust the device to deal Stun damage. While the lightsaber is set to deal Stun damage, it decreases the damage it deals by two, increases its critical rating by one, and loses the Breach quality. Adjusting the lightsaber to normal settings requires another maneuver. Modification Options: 2 Item Quality (Stun damage +1) Mods.

name: Overcharged Power Cell
reference: Please see page 51 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Wielder can spend [AD] from combat checks to increase damage by 1.  GM can spend [TH][TH] to decrease damage by 1.

description: Those who know what they are doing can sometimes overcharge the power cell of a lightsaber to increase the power of the blade, but these changes make the power cell volatile and potentially unstable.
details: This attachment can only be applied to lightsabers. Models Include: None; users must custom-make each lightsaber attachment. Base Modifiers: The wielder of this lightsaber can spend an Advantage on a combat check to increase the damage by one, and the GM can spend two Threat results to decrease the damage dealt by one. Modification Options: None.

name: Pistol Hilt
reference: Please see page 52 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Includes a built-in blaster pistol.

description: While the Jedi of old disdained blasters, modern Force users tend to need every advantage they can get.
details: This attachment can only be applied to lightsabers. The user must spend a maneuver to switch from one weapon mode to the other (from lightsaber function to pistol function, for example). Models Include: None; users must custom-make each lightsaber attachment. Base Modifiers: When the lightsaber is not ignited, the wielder may fire the pistol using the following profile: (Ranged - Light; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range [Short]; Stun damage). Modification Options: None.

name: Reflex Grip
reference: Please see page 52 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When lightsaber is used to Parry or Reflect, suffer 1 additional strain, but count Parry and Reflect ranks as 1 higher.

description: Through a delicate system of motion sensors and miniaturized motors built into a lightsaber hilt, a craftsperson can alter the lightsaber to respond to adjustments in grip and position with greater responsiveness.
details: This attachment can only be applied to lightsabers. Models Include: None; users must custom-make each lightsaber attachment. Base Modifiers: When a character uses a Parry talent or Reflect talent incidental with a lightsaber that has a reflex grip installed, the character suffers 1 additional strain, but counts their ranks in Parry talent and Reflect talent as 1 higher. Modification Options: 1 Item Quality (Defensive +1) Mod, 1 Item Quality (Deflection +1) Mod.

name: Shien Reverse Grip Customization
reference: Please see page 52 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Wielder adds [AD] to all Lightsaber (Cunning) checks, but adds [TH] to all other Lightsaber checks.

description: Practitioners of Form V sometimes use a reverse grip on their lightsabers to assist in many of the techniques common to that form.
details: This attachment can only be applied to lightsabers. Models Include: None; users must custom-make each lightsaber attachment. Base Modifiers: The wielder adds an Advantage result to all Shien Technique talent Lightsaber checks made with this lightsaber but adds a Threat result to all other Lightsaber checks. Modification Options: None.

name: Etaan Crystal
reference: Please see page 52 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: If wielder uses the Improved Reflect talent to inflict an automatic hit, increase damage by 2.

details: Base Modifiers: Installing this crystal changes a lightsaber's base damage to 6 and critical rating to 2, and the lightsaber gains the Breach 1 and Sunder weapon qualities. If the crystal is ever removed, the lightsaber loses these qualities and reverts to its previous base damage and critical rating. In addition, while the Etaan crystal is installed in the lightsaber, if the character wielding the lightsaber uses the Improved Reflect talent to inflict an automatic hit, increase the damage dealt by that hit by 2. Modification Options: 1 Item Quality (Vicious +1) Mod, 2 Damage +1 Mods, 1 Decrease the weapon's critical rating by 1 to a minimum of 1 Mod, 1 Innate Talent (Parry talent) Mod, 1 Innate Talent (Reflect talent) Mod.

details: Base Modifiers: Installing this crystal changes a lightsaber's base damage to 6, critical rating to 2, and the lightsaber gains the Breach 1 and Sunder item qualities. If the crystal is ever removed, the lightsaber loses these qualities and reverts to its previous base damage and critical rating. Modification Options: 2 Damage +1 Mods, 2 Item Quality (Defensive +1) Mods.

name: Collision Avoidance System
reference: Please see page 58 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Reduce silhouette by 1 for purposes of determining difficulty of Piloting checks.

description: Due to their speed and the primitive nature of their handling systems, Podracers are notoriously difficult to control.
details: This mod may only be installed on Podracers. Models Include: Aratech 8pz-X Constant Active Aray, Fabritech "Co-Pilot" Adaptive Anti-Collision System, SoroSuub LX-19 Automatic Spot Thrusters. Base Modifiers: Reduce Podracer's silhouette by 1 for purposes of determining the difficulty of Piloting - Planetary and Piloting - Space. Modification Options: None.

name: Podracer Ejection System
reference: Please see page 58 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.
description: This is a simple pilot's ejection seat, commonly found in starfighters and combat airspeeders.
details: This mod may only be installed on Podracers. Models Include: Incom ACE Ejection Seat, Koensayr Np-K36 Ejection Seat, Sienar Fleet Systems Mk GT8 Deluxe Ejection Pod. Base Modifiers: Equips a Podracer with an ejection system. To eject, a pilot makes an Average difficulty Piloting (Planetary) check as an out of turn incidental in response to [their] Podracer being destroyed. On a successful check, the pilot is ejected from the crashing vehicle unharmed. On a failed check, the pilot suffers a number of strain equal to the vehicle's speed at the time of the crash, plus 1 Critical Injury. Game Masters can spend two threat results or a despair result to deal wounds instead of strain.

base_mods.misc_desc: To eject, make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Piloting (Planetary) check[b] as an out-of-turn incidental.  On success, pilot is ejected unharmed.  On failure, pilot suffers vehicle speed in strain, plus one Critical Injury.  GM can spend [TH][TH] or [DE] to cause wounds to be suffered instead.

name: Foreign Debris Ejector
reference: Please see page 58 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Ejects debris into the air behind podracer.  Any racer within close range and behind must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Piloting (Planetary) check[b] to avoid debris.  Failure reduces speed by 1 for 2 rounds, plus 1 round per [TH].  [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] can inflict Critical Hit on target vehicle.
May only be used once per race.

description: Podracing attracts a wide range of pilots, from those who delight in testing their skill against fellow speed enthusiasts to those who are only interested in winning, no matter what it takes.
details: This mod may only be installed on Podracers. Models Include: Various (pilots and their crew typically craft them secretly). Base Modifiers: Equips the Podracer with an aft-mounted compartment filled with hazardous debris. The compartment can be activated as a maneuver to eject the debris into the air. If there is a Podracer within close range and directly behind the vehicle, that Podracer's pilot must make a Hard (3 Difficulty) Piloting - Planetary to avoid the ejected debris. Failure reduces the target Podracer's speed by 1 for 2 rounds, plus 1 additional round for each Threat result. Three Threat results or a Despair result can be spent to inflict a Critical Hit on the targeted vehicle. Once used, this modification cannot be used again until the next race. Modification Options: None.

name: Handling Upgrades
reference: Please see page 59 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.
description: Podracer handling upgrades encompass a wide array of systems and technologies designed to make Podracers easier to pilot.

Base Modifiers: Increases a Podracer's handling by 1. Modification Options: 2 Increase a Podracer's handling by 1 Mods.

name: High-Output Repulsor Coils
reference: Please see page 59 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

details: This mod may only be installed on Podracers. Models Include: Incom TX-2, Bespin Motors Ponrez/Arc Repulsorlift, Karydee KD49 Drive Unit. Base Modifiers: Increase Podracer's maximum altitude by 50 meters. Modification Options: 3 Increase Podracer's maximum altitude by 50 meters Mods.

name: Reinforced Engine Cowlings
reference: Please see page 59 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Reduce Critical Hit result from collision by 20

added_mods.misc_desc: Reduce Critical Hit result from collision by 20

description: Part of the thrill of Podracing is the near-certainty of collisions; for many enthusiasts, a good race is measured by how many crashes occurred, not how fast the winner ran the circuit.
details: This mod may only be installed on Podracers. Models Include: Various models. Base Modifiers: Reduces the Critical Hit result the vehicle suffers in a collision by 20. Modification Options: 1 Reduce the Critical Hit result the vehicle suffers in a collision by 20 Mod.

name: Podracer Shield Generator
reference: Please see page 59 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

name: Podracer Control Cables
reference: Please see page 60 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

details: Models Include: Steelton Perfect-Series control cables, Moriales Systems SC-4.x control tether. Base Modifiers: Grants a Podracer a Handling of –1. Modification Options: None

name: Podracer Engine
reference: Please see page 60 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.
description: Podracer engines come in three varieties: rocket motors, turbine engines, and high-performance ion engines.
details: Models Include: TurboDyne 99-U, Manta RamAir Mk IV Flat Twin Turbojet, JAK Racing J930 Dash-8, Radon-Ulzer 620C, S&K JZ-5 Fusial Thrust Engine, Income 2a Fission Engine. Base Modifiers: Grants a Podracer a speed of 4. Modification Options: None

name: Rocket Guidance System
reference: Please see page 47 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Most micro-rockets are fired directly at their target, relying on the firer's aim and the rocket's acceleration to ensure a direct hit.
details: This attachment can be installed on any Micro-Rocket. Models Include: Pharr Co. 'Vornskr" Guidance Package, Merr-Sonn "Outreach" Target Sensor. Base Modifiers: Grants the weapon the Guided (+2) quality. Modification Options: 3 Item Quality (Guided +1) Mods, 2 Item Quality (Accurate +1) Mods.

name: Staged Rocket Booster
reference: Please see page 47 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: The limitations of size mean that most micro-rockets lack the fuel capacity to reach distant targets.
details: This attachment can be installed on any Micro-Rocket. Models Include: SoroSuub HV-33 Fuel Filter. Base Modifiers: Increases the weapon's range by one range band. Adds the Inaccurate (+2) quality to the weapon. Modification Options: 1 Increase the weapon's range by one additional range band Mod, 2 Reduce the weapon's Inaccurate quality by 1 Mods.

name: Marked-Target Firing Lock
reference: Please see page 51 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Models Include: BlasTech "Surefire" Safety Sensor, Cadregg Armory Model-87 Weapon Sensor. Base Modifiers: The wielder of a weapon with this attachment may designate a target as an incidental while performing the aim maneuver. Once a target has been designated, the weapon cannot be fired at another target. All combat checks made with the weapon to attack the designated target cancel one additional Threat result after Threat has been used to cancel any Advantage results. Only one target can be designated at a time, and the wielder may disengage the lock as a maneuver. Modification Options: 1 Cancel an additional Threat result Mod.

name: Shock Pulse Emitter
reference: Please see page 51 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Shock pulse emitters operate along principles similar to a blaster's Stun setting, but at a much shorter effective range-short enough to make them of little use as standalone.
details: This attachment can be installed on any Melee or Brawl weapon. Models Include: Corellian Personal Defense Stun Pad. Base Modifiers: Grants the weapon the Stun (+2) quality. Modification Options: 1 Item Quality (Disorient +1) Mod, 2 Item Quality (Stun +1) Mods.

name: Under-Barrel Micro-Rocket Rack
reference: Please see page 51 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Modification Options: 2 Mount one additional micro-rocket Mods, 2 Remove a Black Setback die from checks to fire micro-rockets from this attachment Mods.

reference: Please see page 52 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

While holstered, these weapons do not count toward the character's encumbrance value. Modification Options: 2 Add a Black Setback die to other characters' Perception checks to find weapons stored in the armor Mods, 3 Holster up to one additional weapon of encumbrance 3 or lower in the armor Mods, 1 Innate Talent (Quick Draw talent) Mod.

name: Micro-Rocket Armor Mounting
reference: Please see page 52 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Enables armor to fire loaded micro-rockets.

details: This attachment can be installed on any armor. Base Modifiers: Enables user to fire one loaded Micro-Rocket without needing to perform a maneuver to draw. Increases encumbrance by +3. Modification Options: 5 Mount one additional micro-rocket Mods, 1 Remove a Black Setback die from checks to fire micro-rockets from this attachment Mod.

name: Replusor-Assisted Lifting

Base Modifiers: Adds +5 to a wearer's Brawn characteristic for the purposes of determining encumbrance threshold. Modification Options: 2 Add +1 to a wearer's Brawn characteristic for the purposes of determining encumbrance threshold Mods, 2 Skill (Athletics +1) Mods.

name: Tracking System
reference: Please see page 52 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Upgrade the ability of checks to track a designated target once.

The wearer may designate a target by spending a maneuver while maintaining line of sight to the target, or through sensor and communication equipment such as a Surveillance Tagger. Only a single target can be designated at a time. Modification Options: 1 Skill (Vigilance) Mod, 1 Skill (Survival) Mod.
description: Through a series of specialized computer systems and sensors, this attachment collects and processes data from the wearer's surroundings to follow and predict the movements of designated targets.

name: Containment Field
reference: Please see page 64 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can hold one Silhouette 1 creature.  Creature can see, hear, and speak, but cannot move.
Operator can attack prisoner.  Prisoner must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b] and suffers 1 damage per [FA] and one [TH] may be used to inflict 1 strain.

details: This attachment can be installed on any vessel of silhouette 4 or higher. Models Include: Gordarl Weaponsmiths A1 Containment Field. Escape under these circumstances is incredibly difficult, and thus can only be attempted at the GM's discretion. As an action, a character operating the field can use it to inflict harm on the prisoner; the character imprisoned inside must make a Hard difficulty Resilience check and suffers 1 damage per failure result on the check. The operator may spend a threat result to inflict 1 strain on the prisoner.
description: Designed for permanent installation, a containment field generator consists of two flat, cylindrical generators—one bolted to the floor, the other to the ceiling—that hold a single individual captive in a powerful stasis field.

name: Enhanced Prisoner Lockup
reference: Please see page 64 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

details: This attachment can be installed on any vessel capable of carrying prisoners. Base Modifiers: Full incarceration and security suite for up to 2 prisoners. Modification Options: 4 Add support for one additional prisoner Mods.

base_mods.misc_desc: Full incarceration and security suite for 2 prisoners.

added_mods.misc_desc: Support for one additional prisoner.

name: Minelayer

Increase mine capacity by 1

details: This attachment can be installed on any starship. Models Include: GSI M-L4 Seeker, Czerka Arms Mk. IX Proton Mine. Base Modifiers: Allows the vehicle to carry a number of mines equal to its silhouette. As an action, a character piloting or operating the weapons on a ship equipped with a minelayer may make an Average difficulty Mechanics check to deploy one mine anywhere within close range. See Space Mines below for more information. Modification Options: 1 Increase deployable range to medium range Mod, 3 increase mine capacity by 1 Mods.
description: Minelayers, and their accompanying ordnance, are anti-ship weapons sold by numerous major galactic arms manufacturers.
